title: He Who Has The GOLD, Has The POWER
body_text:
DODGEBALL 159 Results!
Championship Chase, Rimshot Contest
Titles Up For Grabs!
The Title on the Line!
Things got kicked off the old-fashioned, good-natured way at DODGEBALL 159 with the 14th pregame Rimshot Contest. To the winner went both the opportunity to organize teams
and
hold the prestigious
Championship Chase
crown to start the wild game of "cat and mouse". WrestleManiac
Travis Mills
was the only one who managed to escape defeat, beating out contestants Mike "Sputz" Krott, John Tronolone, Juan Londono, Bobby Vetrano, Kevin Fitzpatrick, Jason Teitelbaum, Chris Adams, Jamie Biesiada, Eamon Fitzpatrick, Kevin Adams, and Jon Yochum.
And they Figured Out to Win!
With the formation of teams came the evening's two-team classic, pitting the Mills-named armies FIGURED IT OUT BY FIGURING IT OUT against MENTAL CASE HOSPITALITY in a wickedly-insane three-hour melee. By the end of six completed rounds, FIGURED IT OUT BY FIGURING IT OUT figured out how to pick up the victory, taking four games.
The Championship Hangs in the Balance!
At the core of the chaos was the feverishly-awaited return of the popular
Championship Chase
. Just twice in over three years has this rare, individual "title" been up for grabs, and with a mystery prize to go with it, players were anxious to grab hold the gold.
From inaugural title holder "Maniac" Mills and incomparable powerhouse Kevin Fitzpatrick to the extremely obsessive John Tronolone and former
Chase
victor Michael Edwards, the champ was a marked man, or woman, throughout this 159th.
After over a dozen title switches, the legendary
Christopher Adams
remained unharmed in his quest to wear the "strap" and with it came the "Create-An-Event" reward!
Chase
results by game are as follows: Mills, K. Fitzpatrick
(G1, G2)
-- K. Adams, DiBuccio, Tronolone
(G3)
-- Edwards, Londono, Krott, K. Adams
[2x]
, Megill
(G4)
-- Tronolone
[2x]
(G5)
-- Krott
[2x]
, Mills
[2x]
, C. Adams
(G6)
.
The Rules
: Classic two-team match-up with individual
Championship Chase
.
The Match
: Team FIGURED IT OUT BY FIGURING IT OUT defeated Team MENTAL CASE HOSPITALITY, 4 - 2.
Moments & Stars
: Chris Adams missing a 20-foot bulletball lob from Travis Mills; John Tronolone failing to catch a Mike Edwards-deflection off teammate Melissa Kerr, losing the title because of it; Kevin Megill wanting Jamie Biesiada to eliminate him in order for the title to change hands
Attendance
: 23, comprised of 17 men and 6 women.
Other Notes
: The was the second week in a row without a single new player.
Player's Choice
Rimshot Contest Notes
: Travis Mills picked up his third RC victory, tying the record for most wins with Ryan Letsche. Travis has won three of the total four
Player's Choice
contests.
Championship Chase
Notes
: DODGEBALL 159 featured just the third
Championship Chase
, the first two held at
DODGEBALL 118
and
DODGEBALL CXL3
. Chris Adams came out victorious after numerous title switches and was rewarded with the "Create-An-Event" mystery prize which he will be able to use during Season 17
(excluding 165 and 170)
.
________________________________________
______
WILL YOU LOOK WHAT'S LEFT ...
body_html:
DODGEBALL 159 Results!
Championship Chase, Rimshot Contest Titles Up For Grabs!

The Title on the Line!
Things got kicked off the old-fashioned, good-natured way at DODGEBALL 159 with the 14th pregame Rimshot Contest. To the winner went both the opportunity to organize teams and hold the prestigious Championship Chase crown to start the wild game of "cat and mouse". WrestleManiac Travis Mills was the only one who managed to escape defeat, beating out contestants Mike "Sputz" Krott, John Tronolone, Juan Londono, Bobby Vetrano, Kevin Fitzpatrick, Jason Teitelbaum, Chris Adams, Jamie Biesiada, Eamon Fitzpatrick, Kevin Adams, and Jon Yochum.

And they Figured Out to Win!
With the formation of teams came the evening's two-team classic, pitting the Mills-named armies FIGURED IT OUT BY FIGURING IT OUT against MENTAL CASE HOSPITALITY in a wickedly-insane three-hour melee. By the end of six completed rounds, FIGURED IT OUT BY FIGURING IT OUT figured out how to pick up the victory, taking four games.

The Championship Hangs in the Balance!
At the core of the chaos was the feverishly-awaited return of the popular Championship Chase. Just twice in over three years has this rare, individual "title" been up for grabs, and with a mystery prize to go with it, players were anxious to grab hold the gold.

From inaugural title holder "Maniac" Mills and incomparable powerhouse Kevin Fitzpatrick to the extremely obsessive John Tronolone and former Chase victor Michael Edwards, the champ was a marked man, or woman, throughout this 159th.

After over a dozen title switches, the legendary Christopher Adams remained unharmed in his quest to wear the "strap" and with it came the "Create-An-Event" reward!

Chase results by game are as follows: Mills, K. Fitzpatrick (G1, G2) -- K. Adams, DiBuccio, Tronolone (G3) -- Edwards, Londono, Krott, K. Adams [2x], Megill (G4) -- Tronolone [2x] (G5) -- Krott [2x], Mills[2x], C. Adams (G6).

The Rules: Classic two-team match-up with individual Championship Chase.
The Match: Team FIGURED IT OUT BY FIGURING IT OUT defeated Team MENTAL CASE HOSPITALITY, 4 - 2.
Moments & Stars: Chris Adams missing a 20-foot bulletball lob from Travis Mills; John Tronolone failing to catch a Mike Edwards-deflection off teammate Melissa Kerr, losing the title because of it; Kevin Megill wanting Jamie Biesiada to eliminate him in order for the title to change hands
Attendance: 23, comprised of 17 men and 6 women.
Other Notes: The was the second week in a row without a single new player.

Player's Choice Rimshot Contest Notes: Travis Mills picked up his third RC victory, tying the record for most wins with Ryan Letsche. Travis has won three of the total four Player's Choice contests.

Championship Chase Notes: DODGEBALL 159 featured just the third Championship Chase, the first two held at DODGEBALL 118 and DODGEBALL CXL3. Chris Adams came out victorious after numerous title switches and was rewarded with the "Create-An-Event" mystery prize which he will be able to use during Season 17 (excluding 165 and 170).

______________________________________________

WILL YOU LOOK WHAT'S LEFT ...
